title: Darken the site-wide background overlay

requirements.text: Increase the darkness of the site-wide background by making the existing overlay gradient on the global HTML background more opaque on both desktop and mobile/portrait breakpoints (in frontend/src/index.css), without changing the background image filenames or the fixed/cover/no-repeat behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/index.css, the linear-gradient overlay alpha values applied to the html background-image are increased (darker) for both the default and the mobile/portrait @media rule.
The background images remain exactly: /assets/generated/site-background-neon-bubbles.dim_1920x1080.png and /assets/generated/site-background-neon-bubbles-mobile.dim_1080x1920.png.
The background properties remain in effect: background-size: cover; background-position: center; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-attachment: fixed.
Foreground content (text/buttons/cards) remains readable and the bubble overlay decorations remain visible against the darker background.

constraints: Do not edit files listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/components/ui).
Do not change the background image filenames/paths or remove fixed/cover/no-repeat behavior from the global background styling.
nonGoals: Adding new pages, sections, or features unrelated to darkening the background.
Changing backend logic (backend/main.mo) or adding persistence/auth features.
Replacing or regenerating background images instead of adjusting the overlay darkness.
